May contain spoilers from Extinction Curse **Source** [Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On](/Sources.aspx?ID=21) pg. 78 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 60 feet **Area** 10-foot burst **Duration** sustained for up to 1 minute --- You blast the area with grit that scours away soil and gets into creatures’ eyes. For the duration of the spell, any plant-based difficult terrain smaller than a tree becomes loose, allowing each 5-foot square of it to be cleared with a single Interact action. In addition, _scouring sand_ attempts to counteract [_entangle_](/Spells.aspx?ID=103) and other effects that create or manipulate plant-based terrain in its area. Successfully counteracting an effect removes only the portion of its area that overlaps with _scouring sand’s_ area. After one such attempt, the effect is temporarily immune to _scouring sand’s_ counteract for 24 hours. Each creature in the area when you Cast this Spell or that ends its turn in the area must attempt a Reflex save. **Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The creature is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 minute or until it uses an Interact action to get the sand out of its eyes.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the creature is also [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for its next action. --- **Heightened (3rd)** Once per round when you [Sustain the Spell](/Actions.aspx?ID=73), you can move the center of the burst to a spot within range. **Heightened (6th)** As the 3rd-level version, except the range is 120 feet and the area is a 20-foot burst.
name: Scouring Sand
